Methods

At(float)

Computes a position along this line.

public Vector2 At(float t)

Parameters

t float

A parameter representing the position along the line to compute. 0 yields the start point and 1 yields the end point.

Returns

Vector2

The position along the line.

EndWorldMatrix()

It's the end of the world as we know it

Matrix4

IntersectWith(in Line)

Intersects this line with another.

public (bool success, float distance) IntersectWith(in Line other)

Parameters

other Line

The line to intersect with.

Returns

(bool success, float distance)

Whether the two lines intersect and, if so, the distance along this line at which the intersection occurs. An intersection may occur even if the two lines don't touch, at which point the parameter will be outside the [0, 1] range. To compute the point of intersection, At(float).

ToString()

Returns the fully qualified type name of this instance.

public override string ToString()

Returns

string

The fully qualified type name.

TryIntersectWith(in Line, out float)

Intersects this line with another.

public bool TryIntersectWith(in Line other, out float distance)

Parameters

other Line

The line to intersect with.

distance float

The distance along this line at which the intersection occurs. To compute the point of intersection, At(float).

Returns

bool

Whether the two lines intersect. An intersection may occur even if the two lines don't touch, at which point the parameter will be outside the [0, 1] range.

TryIntersectWith(ref Vector2, ref Vector2, out float)

Intersects this line with another.

public bool TryIntersectWith(ref Vector2 otherStart, ref Vector2 otherEnd, out float distance)

Parameters

otherStart Vector2

The start point of the other line to intersect with.

otherEnd Vector2

The end point of the other line to intersect with.

distance float

The distance along this line at which the intersection occurs. To compute the point of intersection, At(float).

Returns

bool

Whether the two lines intersect. An intersection may occur even if the two lines don't touch, at which point the parameter will be outside the [0, 1] range.
